info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued November 09 at 1:09PM PST until November 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 10 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Visibility as low as a quarter of a mile and slick surfaces due to freezing fog. * WHERE...Most portions of the Klamath Basin, inlcuding Klamath Falls, Modoc Point, Chiloquin, Bonanza, and Keno, and portions of highways 97 and 140. * WHEN...From 4 AM to 10 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and slick road surfaces. Walking surfaces may become hazardous. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * If possible, wait for temperatures to warm above freezing before traveling. * Slow down and give 3 times as much space as normal between vehicles. * Shaded areas may be more slippery than unshaded areas. * Use low beams. High beams reflect back fog making visibility worse for you and other drivers. * Fog makes objects appear farther away than they are. * Be ready for low visibility by keeping your headlights clean. * Don`t use cruise control. Most crashes occur because the driver is going too fast for weather conditions.
